remediationReport.scope: Non-CA/TX containment failures from WS-3 analysis

summary.description: Remediated containment failures in AL, LA, MO, OH, MI, MN, OK, PA, SC, TN, NJ where registry contained county-level or regional district data instead of city council districts
summary.methodology: Manual review of each entry against WS-3 containment failure analysis, identifying wrong data sources (county commissioners, parish councils, regional districts) vs legitimate city-county consolidations

cities.reason: County commissioner districts (10 features), not city council
Birmingham/Jefferson County districts (9 features), separate city
Birmingham/Jefferson County districts (9 features), separate city
St. Mary Parish districts (8 features), not city council

exceptedCities.reason: City-Parish consolidated government (East Baton Rouge Parish Metro Council) - legitimate boundary includes parish
exceptedCities.notes: 12 districts cover full parish; city and parish merged governance. 81.1% overflow is expected and correct.

cities.reason: St. Louis County districts (7 features), separate city

Cuyahoga County council districts (11 features), separate city
Montgomery County districts (1 feature), not city council
Tulsa County precinct data (13 features), city has 4 wards

immediate: Verify Baton Rouge exception is correctly handled in containment validation logic

validation: Verify quarantine count and summary statistics
Document restoration process for entries with correct data found
